ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: - Strong, interesting lectures - Valuable course material
Lectures were really engaging and interesting. Easterling really catches your attention during them.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: - Discussion period could have been facilitated better.

I think there should be an assignment in which we have to answer to Keller's demand for a new kind of activism within our respective disciplines. Whether it's the design of a active form or a switch or whatever, it would be great to take the time to decide how the lessons of the course could be applied directly to our own life trajectories.
My section was not great... It wasn't very engaging and most people did not participate. More questions to guide the section, maybe given to students beforehand, could probably make it more dynamic.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The discussions were generally poorly facilitated and could benefit from having a stronger facilitator.

Section discussions were generally lacking in enthusiasm and content. I don't know what Keller could have done, though. I think it might have just been the group. Also, presentations on the reading were often lackluster. Many people are not good at speaking in front of others and often presentations were hard to follow. Generally, readings were not clarified in section. I would prefer not having a discussion section and instead having an extra assignment somewhere in the semester that is meant to synthesize the reading.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
Why did you take this course?
comments: Although the course does not directly relate to my course of study, I find the subject material interesting and peripherally relevant to my interests.
It was recommended by previous course students.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
